entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 3:51AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG EARLY THIS MORNING... Areas of dense fog have formed across central Illinois early this morning. The fog is most widespread east of the Illinois River, and will be expanding east of the I-55 corridor. Visibility below a quarter mile will occur at times. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 3:05AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOCALLY DENSE FOG AFFECTING PARTS OF NORTHERN MINNESOTA... Areas of locally dense fog will affect areas along and north of the Iron Range, as well as around the Brainerd Lakes, including Grand Rapids, International Falls, Ely, Hibbing, Brainerd and Aitkin. Visibilities of 1/2 to 1/4 mile have already been observed, which should persist through the overnight hours.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central St. Louis; Crow Wing; Koochiching; North Cass; North Itasca; North St. Louis; Northern Aitkin; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; South Aitkin; South Cass; South Itasca

entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT SUNDAY... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Pollution Advisory...in effect until 5 PM PDT Sunday. entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued September 16 at 9:15PM PDT until September 17 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Dry and Breezy Conditions on Sunday... .A dry cold front will push across the region on Sunday after a period of warm and dry conditions this week. Breezy westerly winds with continued dry conditions will bring the potential for rapid fire spread Sunday afternoon and evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 8 PM PDT
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Columbia Basin, Palouse, Spokane Area; Lower Palouse, Snake River; Waterville Plateau; Western Columbia Basin

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued September 16 at 8:54PM PDT until September 17 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BREEZY TO WINDY WITH LOW HUMIDITY ON SUNDAY... .A dry cold front sweeping across Washington on Sunday will allow winds to increase, becoming breezy to locally windy during the afternoon and evening hours. The combination of low relative humidity and winds will lead to critical fire weather conditions in the area.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 3:05AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOCALLY DENSE FOG AFFECTING PARTS OF NORTHWEST WISCONSIN... Areas of locally dense fog will affect portions of northwest Wisconsin overnight, including Siren, Spooner, Hayward, Ashland, Mellen and Hurley. Visibilities of 1/2 to 1/4 mile have already been observed, which should persist through the overnight hours. Visibilities are expected to improve after sunrise Sunday
